insert into user_requirement (id, type, name, appoint_date, address_id, requirements, remark, age_max, age_min, experience, native_place, status, user_id, assign_ids) values (#{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{type,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{appointDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{addressId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{requirements,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{ageMax,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{ageMin,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{experience,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{nativePlace,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{status,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{assignIds,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
mapper.update: update user_requirement set type = #{type,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, appoint_date = #{appointDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, address_id = #{addressId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, requirements = #{requirements,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, remark = #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, age_max = #{ageMax,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, age_min = #{ageMin,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, experience = #{experience,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, native_place = #{nativePlace,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, status = #{status,jdbcType=INTEGER}, user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, assign_ids = #{assignIds,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select id, type, name, appoint_date, address_id, requirements, remark, age_max, age_min, experience, native_place, status, user_id, assign_ids from user_requirement where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
